TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit NameValueFileSectionHandler extends System.Object implements class System.Configuration.IConfigurationSectionHandler

Docs.summary: Provides access to a configuration file. This type supports the .NET Framework configuration infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The `file` attribute of the `<appSettings>` section specifies a relative path to an external file that contains custom application-configuration settings. The details provided in the file act as an `<appSettings>` section in the configuration file. The file is accessed using the <xref:System.Configuration.NameValueFileSectionHandler> class. The file's root element must match the section referring to it.

MemberSignature.Value: public object Create (object parent, object configContext, System.Xml.XmlNode section);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance object Create(object parent, object configContext, class System.Xml.XmlNode section) cil managed
Public Function Create (parent As Object, configContext As Object, section As XmlNode) As Object
public: virtual System::Object ^ Create(System::Object ^ parent, System::Object ^ configContext, System::Xml::XmlNode ^ section);
abstract member Create : obj * obj * System.Xml.XmlNode -> obj override this.Create : obj * obj * System.Xml.XmlNode -> obj

Docs.summary: Creates a new configuration handler and adds it to the section-handler collection based on the specified parameters.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The `parent` object parameter acts as the configuration settings in the corresponding parent configuration section. The `configContext` object parameter is the virtual path for which the configuration section handler computes configuration values. Normally this parameter is reserved and is `null`. The `section` parameter is the <xref:System.Xml.XmlNode> that contains the configuration information to be handled. The `section` parameter provides direct access to the XML contents of the configuration section.

Docs.exception:
The file specified in the attribute of exists but cannot be loaded.
\- or -
The attribute of does not match the root element of the file specified in the attribute.
